This should be understood as partial/slow coral bleaching from coral-algal DESYMBIOSIS, followed by stress-induced coral auto-pigmentation, followed by pigmentation-induced partial algal resymbiosis, and then followed by chronic stress-induced coral death. Rather than the also common occurrence of fast desymbiosis-induced coral bleaching followed and quick death.

Scishow conclusion that the corals are stressed is just more speculation, mandatory to tie it to climate change caused by human activity. Ocean temperatures vary over last 40 years by +/- 0.3 deg C. For the last 5 years it has been cooling and is now -0.3 deg C below average. The Scishow assumptions are nonsense. The corals are actually happy and flushed with color because they losing annoying partners and the ocean and air temps are decreasing. http://www.climate4you.com/SeaTemperatures.htm

Please watch "Chasing Corals" if you haven't already. It is both an astoundingly beautiful and terrifying account of how these global bleaching events are destroying the coral reefs worldwide. The filmmakers went to extreme lengths to record timelapse footage of the bleaching events and it is heartwrenching to realise that we are the ones causing all this. The film is available to watch for free here on YouTube. It will be worth every second of your time and I genuinely hope you watch it. Here's the trailer:

To all those who who devotedly believe humans at fault without all the facts, you need to research the sample cores extracted from a 1,000 + yr old mushroom coral taken from the Whitsunday islands, Queensland, Australia to help you identify the reasons the changes in water clarity obviously due to nature . These core samples show the difference of seasons, namely the wet seasonal events. This is not man made "Climate Change" as the ones who only research in one direction trying to blame mankind, the proof is there showing the facts of before so-called mankind intervention of what was a believed perfect balanced world of nature to their liking.
